author: Andrll
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

This repository is **ONLY** for PowerShell Core 6 and PowerShell 7+ issues.

- Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/known-issues-ps6).

-->

## Steps to reproduce

Run the PowerShell 7.0.3 session. Click Fn+Left Arrow or Fn+Right Arrow, the '@' character will be printed.

## Expected behavior

Fn+Left Arrow and Fn+Right Arrow expect to move the cursor to the beginning or to the end of the line and not print extra characters.

## Actual behavior

Fn+Left Arrow and Fn+Right Arrow prints an extra character ('@').

## Environment data

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.3
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.3
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18362
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

## Comments

It looks like a regression. The issue has not been observed in at least one of the previous versions.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: It looks like PSReadline issue. Please unload the module in your session and check again. Also please install latest PSReadline version and check too.

title: PowerShell 7.0.3 prints '@' character on Fn+Left Arrow or Fn+Right Arrow
